alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 06 at 9:02AM EDT until August 06 at 11:15AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Pulaski County in south central Kentucky... Northeastern Wayne County in south central Kentucky... * Until 1115 AM EDT. * At 902 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Somerset, Monticello, Burnside, Frazer, Betsey, Mill Springs, Kidder, Quinton, Steubenville, Bronston, General Burnside S.P., Tateville, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Sloans Valley, Trimble and Ferguson. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
